headline: CNN Live Event/Special
subHeadline: CNN International: Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu Addresses U.S. Congress. Aired 2-3p ET

utterances.speaker: PAULA NEWTON, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: And this is something that could have scarcely been imagined, Netanyahu in 2015, in fact, said in a speech, he said to both Republicans and Democrats, he said I know no matter which side of the aisle you sit, you stand with Israel. I'm not sure he could make that statement today as we await his address to Congress.I want to bring in our Clare Sebastian now who is monitoring all of this from London for our international reaction. I mean, Clare, look, we now have heard that in fact, negotiations have been postponed even further, that Israel will not be sending negotiators onwards until next week. What hangs in the balance here, especially when we have seen even U.S. allies really bristle the kind of support they have had for Israel in the last few months?

utterances.speaker: CLARE SEBASTIAN, CNN CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Yes, I think, Paula, that is the key reason why the world is watching this visit so closely, will it bring any progress towards that elusive ceasefire? And I think hopes pretty dimmed already going into this one because of that delay of the Israeli delegation going to Cairo to join those talks.Secondly, you know, we've even had one of the -- a key member of parliament in Israel, Benny Gantz, former member of the war cabinet, coming out and accusing Netanyahu of essentially trying to run out the clock on the Knesset session. They go into a three-month recess next week, then of course, the concerns which by the way have also been expressed by President Biden that Netanyahu is doing this more motivated by his own political survival than anything else. But of course, on the other hand, there is still the sense that Israel is engaged in these talks. There are questions around whether President Biden will be tougher on Netanyahu now that he doesn't have to worry as much about U.S. voters, now that he's no longer in the race. So, from the international perspective, those are the key questions going into this. And of course, as we see this new assault on Khan Younis having started this week, that raises the stakes even higher. And we also have international organizations coming out and trying to keep the focus on the humanitarian situation. And frankly also, the material nature of this relationship between the U.S. and Israel. Amnesty International coming out ahead of this visit and calling again for the U.S., the Biden administration to stop supplying weapons to Israel. Enough is enough, is that statement from Amnesty International. Paula.

utterances.speaker: NEWTON
utterances.sentences: Yes, there are as I said, been allies behind closed doors questioning the United States as to why their military aid would not give them more leverage in the ceasefire negotiations vis-a-vis what Netanyahu intends to do. Clare Sebastian, you also will stand by for us. Good to have your input there.We want to go back to our panel now, Alon Pinkas, Aaron David Miller and Jim Sciutto. I think it is appropriate now that we can pivot to what a Kamala Harris position on all of this will look like in the coming months, especially during the campaign. You know, it's not lost on anyone that she -- the second gentleman, Mr. Emhoff has been out there really in support of Israel, also backing though his wife and his wife's position, that some say that behind closed doors, she has been much more strident on the issue than certainly the Biden administration has been in public. I mean, Alon, I'm wondering what you think in terms of how different the Kamala Harris policy will be in the -- ALON PINKAS, DIPLOMAT & FORMER ISRAELI CONSUL GENERAL IN NEW YORK: Well --

utterances.speaker: NEWTON
utterances.sentences: Coming months as she's on the campaign trail.

utterances.speaker: PINKAS
utterances.sentences: Well, I have to tell you, I'll tell you two things. The first is, in general, describing American Presidents and their relations with Israel since Harry Truman in 1948(ph), there has only been one President that Israel could -- that I forget Israel. But describe as a sentimental down to the core Zionist President.And that's Joe Biden. There have been very friendly Presidents and the definition of what constitutes friendly and supportive obviously varies politically. Bill Clinton was very supportive, Richard Nixon was supportive of Israel materially, if not ideologically, George W. Bush was, Barack Obama was, and some people say Donald Trump was. OK. But no one -- no one comes even close to Joe Biden's level. Which is why even though politically, Kamala Harris is his vice president, and she's running on a ticket that he would have run or should have run until the 72 hours ago, comparing her to him is somewhat historically at least unfair. Then let's be practical, I think that in the next, you know, on the 105 days until the election, she's going to try and stay away from the school called the Middle East, it's not being --

utterances.speaker: NEWTON
utterances.sentences: Alon, I'm just going to go now into the chamber as we see Benjamin Netanyahu entering this joint session of congress. Lets listen. [14(CHEERING) (APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: JIM SCIUTTO, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: Well, you might describe this as a raucous welcome to the Israeli Prime Minister, but one, given the -- that the majority of those present are Republicans, because such a large portion of the Democratic caucus is deliberately not present for this speech.You can presume that the bulk of that applause coming from the Republican side of the aisle. As he approaches the podium, it's the fourth time he will have addressed the U.S. Congress, surpassing now Winston Churchill, shaking hands there with the Republican House Speaker and Senator Ben Cardin, Democrat presiding because Vice President Kamala Harris, who normally will be sitting in that chair is not today. She had a previously scheduled event, she's campaigning, but you can imagine, there is a political message coming from the Vice President as well and now presumptive Democratic nominee. Let's listen as the Israeli Prime Minister prepares to address the Congress, and you might say to address the American people. (APPLAUSE) REP. MIKE JOHNSON (R-LA): Members of Congress, I now have the high privilege and distinct honor of presenting to you his excellency Benjamin Netanyahu, prime minister of Israel. (CHEERS) (APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: BENJAMIN NETANYAHU, ISRAELI PRIME MINISTER
utterances.sentences: Thank you.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: Speaker of the House Mike Johnson, Senator Ben Cardin, Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries, Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer, Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell, senators, members of Congress, distinguished guests.Mr. Speaker, I want to thank you for giving me the profound honor of addressing this great citadel of democracy for the fourth time. (APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: We meet today at a crossroads of history. Our world is in upheaval. In the Middle East, Iran's axis of terror confronts America, Israel and our Arab friends. This is not a clash of civilizations; it's a clash between barbarism and civilization.(APPLAUSE) NETANYAHU: It's a clash between those glorify death and those who sanctify life. (APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: For the forces of civilization to triumph, America and Israel must stand together.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: Because -- because when we stand together, something very simple happens(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: And my friends, I came to assure you today of one thing(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: Ladies and gentlemen, like December 7th, 1941 and September 11th, 2001, October 7th is a day that will forever live in infamy. It was the Jewish holiday of Simchat Torah. It began as a perfect day -- not a cloud in the sky. Thousands of young Israelis were celebrating at an outdoor music festival, and suddenly, at 6Three thousand Hamas terrorists stormed into Israel. They butchered 1,200 people from 41 countries, including 39 Americans. Proportionately, compared to our population size, that's like 20 9/11s in one day. And these monsters, they raped women, they beheaded men, they burned babies alive, they killed parents in front of their children and children in front of their parents, they dragged 255 people, both living and dead, into the dark dungeons of Gaza. Israel has already brought home 135 of these hostages, including seven who were freed in daring rescue operations. (APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: One of those freed hostages, Noa Argamani, is here in the gallery, sitting near my wife, Sara. On the morning --(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: Noa -- I think it's one of the most moving things. When Noa was reunited with her mother Liora and her mother's last wish came true. Noa, we're so thrilled to have you with us today. Thank you.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: Many hostage families are also here with us today, including Ariel Bibas.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: Ariel Bibas is the grandfather of those two beautiful, red- headed boys, the Bibas boys, toddlers. And they were taken hostage with their mother and Noa's -- sorry -- and Ariel's son -- the entire family was taken hostage, two beautiful red-haired children taken hostage. What monsters.And with us also is Iris Haim, whose son, Yotam, bravely escaped Hamas captivity with two other Israelis, and tragically they were killed making their way back to our lines. We have with us also the families of American hostages. (APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: They're here.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: The pain these families have endured is beyond words. I met with them again yesterday, and I promised them this(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: As we speak, we're actively engaged in intensive efforts to secure their release. And I'm confident these -- that these efforts can succeed. Some of them are taking place right now.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: I want to thank President Biden for his tireless efforts on behalf of the hostages and for his efforts to the hostage families as well.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: I thank President Biden for his heartfelt support for Israel. After the savage attack on October 7th, he rightly called Hamas "sheer evil." He dispatched two aircraft carriers to the Middle East to deter a wider war. And he came to Israel to stand with us during our darkest hour, a visit that will never be forgotten.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: President Biden and I have known each other for over 40 years. I want to thank him for half a century of friendship to Israel and for being, as he says, "a proud Zionist" -- actually he says "a proud Irish-American Zionist."(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: My friends, for more than nine months, Israel's soldiers have shown boundless courage. With us today --(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: With us today is Lieutenant Avihail Reuven (ph).(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: You heard that right. He ran eight miles, came to the frontlines, killed many terrorists, and saved many, many lives.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: Avihail (ph), we all honor your remarkable heroism.Another Israeli is with us here today, and he's standing -- stand up -- right next to -- right next to Avihail (ph). This is Master Sergeant Ashraf Falbaheri (ph). (APPLAUSE) NETANYAHU Ashraf (ph) is a veteran soldier from the Israeli Muslim community of Rahat. On October 7th, Ashraf (ph), too, killed many terrorists. First, he defended his comrades in the military base, and he then rushed to defend the neighboring communities, including the devastated community of kibbutz Be'eri. Like Ashraf (ph) -- (APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: Like Ashraf (ph), the Muslim soldiers of the IDF fought alongside their Jewish, Druze, Christian and other comrades in arms with tremendous bravery.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: A third hero, Lieutenant Asa Solfer (ph), is also here with us. (APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: Asa (ph) fought as an officer in the tank corps, and he was wounded in battle. He was wounded in battle while protecting his fellow soldiers from a grenade. He lost his right arm and the vision in his left eye. He's recovering. And incredibly, within a short time, Asa (ph) will soon return to active duty as a commander of a tank company.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: I just learned there's a fourth hero here, Lieutenant Jonathan Benhamo (ph), who lost a leg in Gaza and continued to fight.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: My friends, these are the soldiers of Israel, unbowed, undaunted, unafraid.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: As the Bible says, (UNTRANSLATED), "They shall rise like lions." They have risen like lions. The lions of Judah. The lions of Israel.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: Yuher (ph), please rise so we can honor your son's sacrifice. And I pledge to you and to all the bereaved families of Israel, some of whom are in this hall today, the sacrifice of your loved ones will not be in vain.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: It will not be in vain because for Israel never again must never be an empty promise. It must always remain a sacred vow, and after October 7th never again is now.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: My friends, defeating our brutal enemies requires both courage and clarity. Clarity begins by knowing the difference between good and evil. Yet incredibly, many anti-Israel protesters, many choose to stand with evil. They stand with Hamas. They stand with rapist and murders. They stand with people who came into the kibbutzim into a home. The parents hid the children, the two babies, in the attic -- in a secret attic. They murdered the families, the parents. They find the secret latch to the hidden attic and then they murder the babies.These protesters stand with them. They should be ashamed of themselves. (APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: CROWD
utterances.sentences: USA! USA! USA!

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: For all we know, Iran is funding the anti-Israel protest that are going on right now outside this building -- not that many, but they're there -- and throughout this city. Well, I have a message for these protesters. When the tyrants of Tehran who had hang gays from cranes and murdered women for not covering their hair are praising promoting and funding you, you have officially become Iran's useful idiots.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: Some of these protesters -- it's amazing, absolutely amazing. Some of these protesters hold up signs proclaiming "gays for Gaza." They might as well hold up signs saying "chickens for KFC."(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: These protesters chant "from the river to the sea," but many don't have a clue what river and what sea they're talking about.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: They not only get an F in Geography, they get an F in History.They call Israel -- they call Israel a colonialist state? Don't they know that the land of Israel is where Abraham, Isaac and Jacob prayed, where Isaiah and Jeremiah preached and where David and Solomon ruled? (APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: For nearly 4,000 years, the land of Israel has been the homeland of the Jewish people. It's always been our home. It will always be our home.(APPLAUSE) It's not only the campus protesters who get it wrong; it's also the people who run those campuses. Eighty years after the Holocaust -- 80 years after the Holocaust, the presidents of Harvard, Penn, and I'm ashamed to say my alma mater, MIT, couldn't bring themselves to condemn the calls for the genocide of Jews. You remember what they said? They said, "It depends on the context." Well, let me give these befuddled academics a little context. (APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: And don't be fooled when the blood libels against the Jewish state come from people who wear fancy silk robes and speak in lofty tones about law and justice.Here's a case in point:  The prosecutor of the International Criminal Court has shamefully accused Israel of deliberately starving the people of Gaza. This is utter, complete nonsense. It's a complete fabrication. (APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: Israel has enabled more than 40,000 aid trucks to enter Gaza. That's half a million tons of food, and that's more than 3,000 calories for every man, women, and child in Gaza. If there are Palestinians in Gaza who aren't getting enough food, it's not because Israel is blocking it, it's because Hamas is stealing it.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: So much for that lie. But here's another -- the ICC prosecutor accuses Israel of deliberately targeting civilians. What in God's green Earth is he talking about? The IDF has dropped millions of flyers, sent millions of text messages, made hundreds of thousands of phone calls to get Palestinian civilians out of harm's way. But at the same time, Hamas -- Hamas does everything in its power to put Palestinian civilians in harm's way. They fire rockets from schools, from hospitals, from mosques. They even shoot their own people when they try to leave the war zone.A senior Hamas official, Fathi Hamad, boasted -- listen to this -- he boasted that Palestinian women and children "excel at being human shields." His words, "excel at being human shields." What monstrous evil. For Israel, every civilian death is a tragedy. For Hamas, it's a strategy. They actually want Palestinian civilians to die, so that Israel will be smeared in the international media and be pressured to end the war before it's won. This would enable Hamas to survive another day and, as they vowed, to carry out October 7th again and again and again. Well, I want to assure you, no matter what pressure is brought to bear, I will never allow that to happen. (APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: The vast majority of Americans have not fallen for this Hamas propaganda. They continue to support Israel. And I want to say thank you, America, and thank you, senators and House members, who continue to support us, continue to support Israel, continue to support the truth and see through the lies. But as for the minority that may have fallen for Hamas' con job, I suggest you listen to Colonel John Spencer. John Spencer is head of urban warfare studies at West Point. He studied every major urban conflict -- I was going to say in -- in modern history. He corrected me. No, in history. Israel, he said, has implemented more precautions to prevent civilian harm than any military in history and beyond what international law requires.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: These heroes here today, the heroic soldiers of Israel, should not be condemned for how they're conducting the war in Gaza, they should be commended for it.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: I want to thank all of you here today who forcefully opposed the false accusations of the ICC and stood up for the truth. These lies are not only libelous, they're downright dangerous. The ICC is trying to shackle Israel's hands and prevent us from defending ourselves. And if Israel's hands are tied, America is next.And I'll tell you what else is next, the ability of all democracies to fight terrorism will be imperiled. That's what's on the line. So let me assure you, the hands of the Jewish state will never be shackled. Israel will always defend itself. (APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: My friends, in the Middle East, Iran is virtually beyond -- behind all the terrorism, all the turmoil, all the chaos, all the killing. And that should come as no surprise. When he founded the Islamic Republic, Ayatollah Khomeini pledged, we will export our revolution to the entire world -- we will export the Islamic revolution to the entire world.Now ask yourself, which country ultimately stands in the way of Iran's maniacal plans to impose radical Islam on the world? And the answer is clear, it's America, the guardian of Western civilization and the world's greatest power. (APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: But Iran understands that to truly challenge America, it must first conquer the Middle East. And for this, it uses its many proxies, including the Houthis, Hezbollah, and Hamas.Yet in the heart of the Middle East, standing in Iran's way is one proud, pro-American democracy, my country, the state of Israel. (APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: That's why -- that's why the mobs in Tehran chant "death to Israel" before they chant "death to America." For Iran, Israel is first. America is next. So when Israel fights Hamas, we're fighting Iran. When we fight Hezbollah, we're fighting Iran. When we fight the Houthis, we're fighting Iran. And when we fight Iran, we're fighting the most radical and murderous enemy of the United States of America.And one more thing. When Israel acts to prevent Iran from developing nuclear weapons, nuclear weapons that could destroy Israel and threaten every American city, every city that you come from, we're not only protecting ourselves. We're protecting you. (APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: My friends, if you'd remember one thing -- one thing from this speech, remember this(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: Ladies and gentlemen, that victory is in sight. Israel's defeat of Hamas will be a powerful blow to Iran's axis of terror. Another part of that axis, Hezbollah, attacked Israel on October 8th, the day after the Hamas attack. It has launched thousands of missiles and drones against us.Eighty-thousand of our citizens in Northern Israel evacuated their homes, becoming effectively refugees in their own land. We're committed to returning them home. We prefer to achieve this diplomatically, but let me be clear, Israel will do whatever it must do to restore security to our northern border and return our people safely to their homes. (APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: Last Friday, a third Iranian proxy, the Houthis, attacked Tel Aviv with a deadly drone. It exploded a few hundred feet from the American consulate, killing one person and injuring nine.On Saturday I authorized a swift response to that attack. All our enemies should know this, those who attack Israel will pay a very heavy price. And as we defend ourselves -- (APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: And as we defend ourselves on all fronts, I know that America has our back and I thank you for it. All sides of the aisle, thank you.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: We also help keep American boots -- we help keep Americans boots off the ground, while protecting our shared interest in the Middle East.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: I deeply appreciate America's support, including in this current war. But this is an exceptional moment. Fast tracking U.S. military aid can dramatically expedite an end to the war in Gaza and help prevent a broader war in the Middle East.In World War II, as Britain on the front lines of civilization, Winston Churchill appealed to Americans with these famous words, "Give us the tools and we'll finish the job." Today, as Israel fights on the front line of civilization, I too appeal to America -- give us the tools faster and we'll finish the job faster. (APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: My dear friends, the war in Gaza could end tomorrow if Hamas surrenders, disarms and returns all the hostages.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: But if they don't, Israel will fight until we destroy Hamas' military capabilities, end its rule in Gaza, and bring all our hostages home.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: That's what total victory means, and we will settle for nothing less.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: The day -- the day after we defeat Hamas, a new Gaza can emerge. My vision for that day is of a demilitarized and de- radicalized Gaza. Israel does not seek to re-settle Gaza, but for the foreseeable future, we must retain overriding security control there to prevent the resurgence of terror, to ensure that Gaza never again poses a threat to Israel.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: Gaza should have a civilian administration run by Palestinians who do not seek to destroy Israel. That's not too much to ask.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: It's a fundamental thing, that we have a right to demand and to receive.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: A new generation of Palestinians must no longer be taught to hate Jews but rather to live in peace with us.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: Those twin words, "demilitarization" and "de- radicalization," those two concepts were applied to Germany and Japan after World War II, and that led to decades of peace, prosperity, and security.(APPLAUSE) NETANYAHU: Following our victory -- following our victory, with the help of regional partners, the demilitarization and de-radicalization of Gaza can also lead to a future of security, prosperity, and peace. That's my vision for Gaza. (APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: The new alliance I envision would be a natural extension of the groundbreaking Abraham Accords. Those accords saw peace forged between Israel and four Arab countries, and they were supported by Republicans and Democrats alike. We could call...(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: I have a name for this new alliance. I think we should call it the Abraham Alliance.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: I want to thank President Trump for his leadership in brokering the historic Abraham Accords.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: Like Americans, Israelis were relieved that President Trump emerged safe and sound from that dastardly attack on him, dastardly attack on American democracy. There is no room for political violence in democracies.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: I also want to thank President Trump for all the things he did for Israel, from recognizing Israel's sovereignty over the Golan Heights to confronting Iran's aggression to recognizing Jerusalem as our capital and moving the American embassy there. (APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: That's Jerusalem, our eternal capital, never to be divided again.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: My dear friends, Democrats and Republicans, despite these times of upheaval, I am hopeful about the future. I'm hopeful about Israel because my people, the Jewish people, emerged from the depths of hell from dispossession and genocide. And against all odds, we restored our sovereignty in our ancient homeland, we built a powerful and vibrant democracy, a democracy that pushes the boundaries of innovation for the betterment of all humanity.I'm hopeful about America because I'm hopeful about Americans. I know how much the people of this country have sacrificed to defend freedom. America will be -- continue to be a force for light and good in a dark and dangerous world. For free peoples everywhere, America remains the beacon of liberty its extraordinary founders envisioned back in 1776. (APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: NETANYAHU
utterances.sentences: Working together, I'm confident that our two nations will vanquish the tyrants and terrorists who threaten us both. As Israel's prime minister, I promise you this -- no matter how long it takes, no -- how -- no matter how difficult the road ahead, Israel will not relent, Israel will not bend. We will defend our land, we will defend our people, we will fight until we achieve victory, victory over liberty -- rather, victory of liberty over tyranny, victory of life over death, victory of good over evil. That's our solemn commitment.(APPLAUSE)
